result.execSummary:
Michael J Dreps was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Michael J Dreps was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J Dreps

records.addlTxt:
8:33 AM Defendant Michael J Dreps in court, in custody.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mitchell Reagan LaCombe in court for Michael J Dreps. 
DA Urmanski spoke w/supervisor from Detention Center today and arrangements were made on June 15th for transport, but an outside Agency is being used for transport. Has confirmation of a date that Deft will be extradited to Texas but cannot say for security purposes, within next 4 days.
Atty Derksen requests signature bond or Deft to be allowed out on $1000-2000 cash bond.
Court denies bond request.

records.addlTxt: As to: Michael J. Dreps re: Notice of Hearing

3:33 and 4:10 PM Defendant Michael J Dreps in court, in custody.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mitchell Reagan LaCombe in court for Michael J Dreps. 
Defense indicates client stipulates to Extradition. State preparing copies and envelopes and provides 6 copies of Waiver of Extradition. Court signs all copies.
Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on June 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
